turn.0: ELI5: How can you sleep for 14+ hours and feel like you didn't sleep at all?
turn.2: It's prob depression, but I gotta get tested.
turn.3: I don’t know about you, but for me, with everything happening in this crazy world, it’s hard not to be depressed and not just situational depression, where you are just terribly sad! For me, it manifests In not wanting to get out of my PJs and sleeping a lot but never feeling rested and energetic, not really sad, but just kind of blah!
turn.4: Yea, I just have no energy and I don't have any responsibilities, I'm 14 so I can work but have no where to work so yay. So I just don't do anything.
turn.5: I’m sorry to hear that! I’m old - but I’ve been battling depression since I was 12 y/o - it’s hard being that age and adults not understanding and expecting you to just “get over it” or the guilt trip “you are so lucky to have that broccoli, kids in Africa are starving” are some of the responses I used to get from adults.  Is there someone that you can trust that you can reach out to?
